results.title: Nikita
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica, Jerome Chalou and Luc Besson
results.brief_description: Nikita (Anne Parillaud) is a junkie psychopath who gets life imprisonment for shooting a cop while she’s high on drugs. Whilst in prison she is given a second chance at life when she is asked to become an undercover agent for the French secret service. Within three years, after gruelling training, Nikita emerges as a superspy, a highly trained assassin, who kills effectively and emotionlessly until she falls in love … and then her world begins to crumble. Filmed with an adrenelin speed by Besson and shot in elegant colour by Thierry Arbogats, “Nikita” is a stylish thriller that breathed new life into the spy genre by its audacious use of style and art direction. From its tense beginning to the rivetting climax, “Nikita” is a non-stop rollercoaster.

results.title: Niki Lauda Explains Formula One
results.brief_description: World racing car champion, Niki Lauda, demonstrates the sheer speed and performance of Formula One driving. Historical footage is used to explore the sport’s development from early days to recent times, including how performance has improved and records are consistently broken. Driving his McLaren, Lauda shows his skills, while animation illustrates the finer technical points,. Designed not only for the general viewer but also the motor racing enthusiast. Rated: G

results.title: Nightwork [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Nicki Roller and Jane Schneider
results.brief_description: A gay primary school teacher discovers through her pupils that her lover may be cheating on her. She decides to take action by hiring a private detective to find the “other woman” and prove infidelity. Cast includes Gosia Dobrowolska and Shayne Foote.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Martin Murphy and Della Churchill
results.brief_description: A masked killer, a series of brutal murders, a confined space, a resourceful young hero and a terrifying confrontation. Nightride cleverly condenses the conventions of the horror film established in Halloween and Friday the 13th into a suspenseful 11 minute film.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Della Churchill and Martin Murphy
results.brief_description: A boy travelling on a night bus is witness to the murders of other passengers, by a masked killer. “Nightride” condenses the conventions of a horror film into 11 minutes, climaxing with a terrifying confrontation between the boy and the killer. This excellent Australian student short has won numerous international and national film festival awards.

results.title: Nightmail
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit, John Grierson, Basil Wright and Harry Watt
results.brief_description: Classic British documentary recounting the journey of the ‘Postal Special’ train from London to Glasgow. Carrying no passengers, the postal staff sort mail on board and receive and despatch mailbags ‘en route’. The non professional cast performed scripted scenes, giving a human dimension to the mechanics of mail delivery. Along with a dry factual voice-over, the soundtrack offered music by composer Benjamin Britten and verse by W.H. Auden.

results.title: Nightlife
results.brief_description: Robin Lehman explores the wonders of the cold seas of Ireland. Shows the many creatures and plants, including scallops, sea anemone, fan worm and jellyfish. This fantastic drama captures some of nature’s most amazing and improbable creations. Without words but accompanied by music and sound effects.

results.title: Nighthawks. What can I do with a male nude?
results.creator_credit: Four Corner Films, Nighthawks, Ron Peck and Paul Hallam
results.brief_description: ‘Nighthawks’ pictures the everyday experiences of a homosexual schoolteacher in a film which is both a subjective account of the teacher’s disjointed emotional life, and a record of the gay scene in London towards the end of the 1970’s. ‘What can I do with a male nude?’ is a witty short film showing the point of view of a gay photographer as he photographs a muscular male model.

results.title: Night wait
results.brief_description: A lonely cripple wanders through the streets at night seeking companionship. A girl at a bus stop makes conversation with him but when he makes further advances she, like the rest of society, rejects him. Cast includes Noela Fergusson and Vittorio Bianchi.

results.title: Night train [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Subotica Films, Coachouse Productions, Tristan Orpen Lynch and John Lynch
results.brief_description: Night train is a romantic drama by first time director John Lynch featuring Oscar nominees John Hurt (Elephant Man, 1984) as Michael Poole, an ex-con man, and Brenda Blethyn (Secrets and Lies, Saving Grace) as Alice, the landlady’s daughter. Upon release from prison, Michael Poole seeks refuge in an effort to avoid pursuit by a sinister gangland boss to whom he owes money. He moves into a house owned by an elderly domineering mother (Pauline Flanagan) and her emotionally repressed daughter, Alice. Poole finds his passion for electric model trains has Alice intrigued and together they find escape in his strange fantasy world. An awkward and tender romance begins to develop between these two rather sad and lonely people, frustrated by their pasts, and determined to find happiness in their future. But Poole is forced to take flight as the mob boss closes in, and with him Alice, on a real night train adventure on the Orient Express. Set in Dublin and filmed on location in Ireland, England and Italy, “Night train” has many delightful and touching moments performed by two great actors and a very capable supporting cast. Cast also includes Lorcan Cranitch, Cathy White, Peter Caffrey, Paul Roe and Rynagh O’Grady. (Awards: Winner Silver Rose Best Actor John Hurt, Schermi d’Amore Verona; Nominated Best European Film John Lynch, Brussels International Film Festival)
